sn35.95:4.1: Then Venerable Māluṅkyaputta went up to the Buddha …
sn35.95:4.3: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dharma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and determined.”
sn35.95:5.1: “Well now, Māluṅkyaputta, what are we to say to the young monks,
sn35.95:5.2: when even an old man like you, elderly and senior, asks the Realized One for brief advice?”
sn35.95:6.1: “Sir, even though I’m an old man, elderly and senior,
sn35.95:6.2: may the Buddha please teach me Dharma in brief! May the Holy one please teach me in brief! Hopefully I can understand the meaning of what the Buddha says.
sn35.95:6.3: Hopefully I can be an heir of the Buddha’s teaching!”
sn35.95:7.1: “What do you think, Māluṅkyaputta? Do you have any desire or greed or fondness for sights cognizable by the eye that you haven’t seen, you’ve never seen before, you don’t see, and you don’t think would be seen?”
sn35.95:8.1: “Do you have any desire or greed or affection for sounds cognizable by the ear …
sn35.95:12.1: phenomena cognizable by the mind that you haven’t cognized, you’ve never cognized before, you don’t cognize, and you don’t think would be cognized?”
sn35.95:13.1: “In that case, when it comes to things that are to be seen, heard, thought, and cognized: in the seen will be merely the seen; in the heard will be merely the heard; in the thought will be merely the thought; in the cognized will be merely the cognized.
sn35.95:13.7: you won’t be here or beyond or in-between the two.
sn35.95:13.8: Just this is the end of suffering.”
sn35.95:14.1: “This is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement:
sn35.95:15.1: ‘When you see a sight, mindfulness is confused
sn35.95:15.2: and attention is focused on the pleasant aspect.
sn35.95:15.3: Experiencing it with a mind full of desire,
sn35.95:16.6: you’re said to be far from extinguishment.
sn35.95:17.1: When you hear a sound, mindfulness is confused
sn35.95:17.2: and attention is focused on the pleasant aspect.
sn35.95:17.3: Experiencing it with a mind full of desire,
sn35.95:18.6: you’re said to be far from extinguishment.
sn35.95:19.1: When you smell an odor, mindfulness is confused
sn35.95:19.2: and attention is focused on the pleasant aspect.
sn35.95:19.3: Experiencing it with a mind full of desire,
sn35.95:20.6: you’re said to be far from extinguishment.
sn35.95:21.1: When you enjoy a taste, mindfulness is confused
sn35.95:21.2: and attention is focused on the pleasant aspect.
sn35.95:21.3: Experiencing it with a mind full of desire,
sn35.95:22.6: you’re said to be far from extinguishment.
sn35.95:23.1: When you experience a touch, mindfulness is confused
sn35.95:23.2: and attention is focused on the pleasant aspect.
sn35.95:23.3: Experiencing it with a mind full of desire,
sn35.95:24.6: you’re said to be far from extinguishment.
sn35.95:25.1: When you know a phenomenon, mindfulness is confused
sn35.95:25.2: and attention is focused on the pleasant aspect.
sn35.95:25.3: Experiencing it with a mind full of desire,
sn35.95:26.6: you’re said to be far from extinguishment.
sn35.95:27.1: When you see a sight with mindfulness,
sn35.95:27.3: Experiencing it with a mind free of desire,
sn35.95:27.4: you don’t keep clinging to it.
sn35.95:28.1: Even as you see a sight
sn35.95:28.3: you wear away, you don’t heap up:
sn35.95:28.6: you’re said to be in the presence of extinguishment.
sn35.95:29.1: When you hear a sound with mindfulness,
sn35.95:29.3: Experiencing it with a mind free of desire,
sn35.95:29.4: you don’t keep clinging to it.
sn35.95:30.1: Even as you hear a sound
sn35.95:30.3: you wear away, you don’t heap up:
sn35.95:30.6: you’re said to be in the presence of extinguishment.
sn35.95:31.1: When you smell an odor with mindfulness,
sn35.95:31.3: Experiencing it with a mind free of desire,
sn35.95:31.4: you don’t keep clinging to it.
sn35.95:32.1: Even as you smell an odor
sn35.95:32.3: you wear away, you don’t heap up:
sn35.95:32.6: you’re said to be in the presence of extinguishment.
sn35.95:33.3: Experiencing it with a mind free of desire,
sn35.95:33.4: you don’t keep clinging to it.
sn35.95:34.1: Even as you savor a taste
sn35.95:34.3: you wear away, you don’t heap up:
sn35.95:34.6: you’re said to be in the presence of extinguishment.
sn35.95:35.1: When you experience a touch with mindfulness,
sn35.95:35.3: Experiencing it with a mind free of desire,
sn35.95:35.4: you don’t keep clinging to it.
sn35.95:36.1: Even as you experience a touch
sn35.95:36.3: you wear away, you don’t heap up:
sn35.95:36.6: you’re said to be in the presence of extinguishment.
sn35.95:37.1: When you know a phenomenon with mindfulness,
sn35.95:37.3: Experiencing it with a mind free of desire,
sn35.95:37.4: you don’t keep clinging to it.
sn35.95:38.1: Even as you know a phenomena
sn35.95:38.3: you wear away, you don’t heap up:
sn35.95:38.6: you’re said to be in the presence of extinguishment.’
sn35.95:39.1: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
sn35.95:39.3: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.
sn35.95:40.1: (The Buddha repeats the verses in full.)
sn35.95:45.1: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.”
sn35.95:46.1: And then Venerable Māluṅkyaputta approved and agreed with what the Buddha said. He got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
sn35.95:46.2: Then Māluṅkyaputta, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and determined, soon
sn35.95:46.3: realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which people from good families rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
sn35.95:46.5: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual life has been lived; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
sn35.95:46.6: And Venerable Māluṅkyaputta became one of the perfected.
